pr_title: Avoid unnecessary shuffling for single-input elementwise operations.

timeline.message:
Use non-underscore methods for series and dataframe comparators.

The underscore ones fail with error such as

"Can only compare identically-labeled Series objects"

when applied to collections whose rows have been permuted.
Only force indexing for multi-input elementwise operations.
Only force indexing for multi-input elementwise operations.

timeline.bodyText:
That's odd. So I guess series > other will be one place where we diverge from the Pandas API (in an easily documented way).
Is there a similar issue for arithmetic operations?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText:
It appears just to be the comparison operators that suffer from this defect.
For PCollections, the order is unspecified, so in some sense one can't say that comparison of "differently-ordered" dataframes should be rejected (as the notion of "differently-ordered" is not well defined).
